title: text
body:
This is a text component with a graphic to the right.

These can be switched if required.

Glossary terms can be linked to: Walkgrove

title: embed-html
body: First used to embed Padlets into the CMI3 courses, this component lets and embed HTML code be added, with a button below to 'complete' and continue to the next component.

instruction: Select the play button to start the video.

instruction: Select the play button to start the video.

title: splitter
content:
See the audio component below

This is a component to 'split' the content - see the scenarios section for an image/button alternative.

body: Complete the content above to continue

title: audio
body:
Character case studies can be displayed here.

Complete the components on this page to unlock the submenu items later.
instruction: Listen to each character's story.

_items.name: Character name 1
_items.transcript: The audio transcript is displayed here.
_items.content: Any information can be added here.

_items.name: Character name 2
_items.transcript: The audio transcript is displayed here.
_items.content: Any information can be added here.

title: parallax
body: First used in CMI3, this is a comnponent which animates assets/text onscreen as the leaner scrolls down the screen.
instruction: Scroll down to continue.

_stickys.body:
A study found that existing corruption pressures on procurement had been amplified by the pandemic.

Select the plus icon to find out more.

_extra.content:
Examples included:

  • In an effort to procure N95 face masks, the United States Federal Government awarded US$ 55 million to a company that had no experience in supplying medical supplies and no recorded employees.
  • In the UK, the government directly procured 3.5 million testing kits, which later turned out to be unusable, while a senior procurement official for the UK National Health Service in London was reported to have traded PPE for private gain.
  • In Brazil, it was reported that the Federal Government purchased masks from a supplier with ties to the President that were 67% more expensive than the other supplier bids for the same procurement contract.

_stickys.body:
Assets and textboxes can be positioned and animnated in from left, right, up, or down - as well as being centered, or off-set.

The mobilesrc and mobilestyle are for tablet and phone resolutions.

title: list
body: A component which helps to display a list of points or questions.

_items.content: Content 1
Content 2
Content 3

title: interactive-video
body: A component which shows a series of videos with questions at the end ...
instruction: Follow the instructions on screen to move through the exercise.

_items.stepBody: Watch the video below, before moving on to answer the related question.
_items.stepInstruction: Select the play button to start the video.

_items.stepBody: Answer the question below then move on to the next video clip.
_items.stepInstruction: Select the correct answer and then Submit.
_items.question: Which is the correct answer? (Only single-choice)

_items.stepBody: Watch the video below before moving on to answer the related question.
_items.stepInstruction: Select the play button to start the video.

_items.stepBody: Answer the question below then move on to the next video clip.
_items.stepInstruction: Select the correct answer and then Submit.
_items.instructionAfter: Move on to the next section to continue.
_items.question: Which is the correct answer? (Only single-choice)

title: video-wall
body: A component which shows thumbnails of videos, which can be sleected in any order to view the video in an overlay.
instruction: Select an image to view the video.

_items.stepInstruction: Select the play button to start the video.
Select the play button to start the video.
Select the play button to start the video.
Select the play button to start the video.

title: topic-summary
body:
This component automatically shows the list of components in the current page, and their completed status.

Once all page components are complete, the body and intruction content changes and this component is set as 'complete', unlocking the next component/page.
instruction: Complete the outstanding components below ...

title: mcq
body:
A question component that can be used for single or multiple chocie questions.

The feedback can be shown in a popup, or inline below.
instruction: Choose one or more options and select Submit.

title: mcq columns
body: A question component with multiple columns for answers.
instruction: Choose an option for each statement and select Submit.

title: matching
body: This question type is ideal for multi-part questions with different answer options.
instruction: Select an option for each statement and select Submit.

title: gmcq
body:
A graphical question component that can be used for single or multiple chocie questions.

The feedback can be shown in a popup, or inline below.
instruction: Choose one or more options and select Submit.

title: gmcq 2 options
body: A GMCQ, with 2 options for each image.
instruction: Choose an option for each imnage and select Submit.

title: slider
body: A slider question which can have a range for the correct answer.
instruction: Drag the slider to make your choice and select Submit.

title: textinput
body: A question which asks the user to input their thoughts.
instruction: Input your answer and select Submit.

title: quiz results
body:
This component will display different text and an image depending on whether the user has correctly answered the questions set.

In this case, not all the questions above were answered correctly - scoring: {0} points
alternate_body:
This component will display different text and an image depending on whether the user has correctly answered the questions set.

In this case, all the questions above were answered correctly - scoring: {0} points

title: dragdrop
body:
The draggable items can be dragged to the placeholders, which can have graphical backgrounds.

On mobile, it adapts to a matching style question.
instruction: Drag the items to the correct area.

_feedback.title: FEEDBACK
_feedback.incorrect: That’s not quite right, have another go.

title: dragdrop
body:
The draggable items can be dragged to the placeholders, which can have graphical backgrounds.

This layout shows one item at a time.

On mobile, it adapts to a matching style question.
instruction: Drag the items to the correct area.

_feedback.title: FEEDBACK
_feedback.incorrect: That’s not quite right, have another go.

title: quickfire
body: This quickfire quiz can be used as a knowledge check anywhere within the course.
instruction: Select an answer to each question to see how you're doing...

_items.stem: This is the second question being asked - which is incorrect?
This is the final question of this quick-fire quiz - which answer is saying goodbye?

_feedback.pass:
Well done

You've passed this quiz with a score of {0}%.

Feedback ...
_feedback.partialFail:
Feedback

You scored {0}% please try again.

Select the Restart button to try again.
_feedback.fail:
Ooops

You scored {0}%, which isn't enough to pass this quiz.

Feedback ...

title: challenge
body:
A timed 'tertris' style game/challenge which drops questions at timed intervals.

The user needs to select one of 2 choices for each question, before it times out and the question disappears.
instruction: Select Start to begin.

_items.content: The choice is True
_items.feedback: The chocie that should have been made was True.

_items.content: The choice is False
_items.feedback: The chocie that should have been made was False.

_items.content: The choice is True once again
_items.feedback: Once again, the chocie that should have been made was True.

_items.content: The choice is False once again
_items.feedback: Once again, the chocie that should have been made was False.

title: ordering
body: A question component which shows stacked options. The learner needs to use the up and down arrows on each option, to place it in the correct order position.
instruction: Use the up and down arrows to place the options in the correct order.

title: sorting
body: A drag drop component that shows one item at a time, to be dragged into one of the placeholder boxes.
instruction: Drag each item into the correct box.

_feedback.title: FEEDBACK
_feedback.incorrect: That’s not quite right, have another go.

title: Disclaimer
body:
This component has a checkbox and skip feature:

  • Checkbox: To show understand the enxt section has controversial content - selecting the checkbox will scroll to the enxt comnponent
  • Skip button: skip the enxt component by scrolling to the one after
instruction: Select 'I understand…' or the Skip button.

title: hotgraphic
body: A background image can have selectable icons placed over it - which display popups when selected.
instruction: Select the icons to find out more.
mobileInstruction: Select the next and back arrows to find out more.

title: actionplan

title: flipcards

Cards can displayed in columns (set for desktop, mobile and tablet).

When sleected, they flip over to display the content on the back.

Each content item can be expanded to display more content.

This content can be text and/or image, in different layouts.

title: timeline
body: This component can be used to display linear items - a timeline of events, or a process…
instruction: View the timeline of events below.

title: tabs
body: Selecting the tabs displays the information ...

title: click-show
body:
This component can display either images or text items.

When the left item is selected, the right side fades in.

This is the image-text version.

title: dialogue
body: Conversations between 2 characters can be displayed within this component.
instruction: Select Start to begin the conversation.

title: branchingScenario
body:
A user- led branching scenario, with options beneath the sceanrio content/image.

Once complete, the leanrer can restart, if they'd like.
instruction: Follow the scenario and make your choices below.

_scenario.speech: The final information is displayed here.

title: branchingScenario
body: As above, but leaving the chocies on-screen…
instruction: Follow the scenario and make your choices below.

_scenario.speech: The final information is displayed here.

title: reflection
body: The first reflection component in this course - see the last topic for the second…
instruction: Enter your thoughts in the box below, then select save. You can export your thoughts by selecting the Save to PDF button.

_items.title: Step 2
_items.question: What are we asking for this reflection input ...?

title: submenu
body:
The submenu can be used as a visual way to jump to pages within the course.

This component is set to unlock the menu options once the 'media' page is complete.
instruction: Select the first topic to begin.

title: explore
body:
This component will show selectable areas of the screen.

When a hotspot is selected, information will display - in a popup ...
instruction: Select the areas of the screen to learn more.

title: explore
body:
This component will show selectable areas of the screen.

When a hotspot is selected, information will display - in a popup, or like here, inline (set position, dimensions) ...
instruction: Select the areas of the screen to learn more.

title: simulation
body: An interactive simulation component - the user watches steps of a process in a system.
instruction: Follow the instructions and use the data to complete the simulation.
introduction:
This scenario is an example process - showing the selection of hotspots and entering of input data.

Select Watch to begin.

_items.content: The hotspot needs to be selected.
The data that is required, is shown in the datasheet.
When messages appear, the user needs to select Continue.
_items.message: This is a message break to say something important about the process.

_items.content: The hotspot needs to be selected.
Select Replay if you'd like to watch this scenario again.
_items.message: You've seen an example of a watch scenario. Scroll down to try completing the scenario yourself.

title: simulation
body: An interactive simulation component - the user practises working through steps of a process in a system - by selecting areas of the screen and/or entering data.
instruction: Follow the instructions and use the data to complete the simulation.
introduction:
This scenario is an example process to practice selecting hotspots and entering input data.

Select Start Practice to begin.

_items.warning: Select the hotspot (which would usually be invisible).
Enter the data as it appears on the datasheet.

_items.message: This is a message break to say something important about the process.

_items.warning: Select the hotspot (which would usually be invisible) to complete the scenario.

_items.message: You've seen an example of a scenario you can practice. Scroll down to see how you do on the evaluation version.

title: simulation
body: An interactive simulation component - evaluating the user working through steps of a process in a system - by selecting areas of the screen and/or entering data.
instruction: Follow the instructions and use the data to complete the simulation.
introduction:
This scenario is an example process to evaluate the selecting hotspots and entering input data.

Select Start Evalutaion to begin.

_items.warning: Select the hotspot (which would usually be invisible).
Enter the data as it appears on the datasheet.

_items.message: This is a message break to say something important about the process.

_items.warning: Select the hotspot (which would usually be invisible) to complete the scenario.

question: Reflect on ...

title: Introduction
body:
Your about to do an assessment ...

You have 2 attempts to pass ...
instruction: Continue, to start the assessment.

title: Question {{questionNumber}} of {{questionCount}}
body: This is the first, and only, question ...
instruction: Select your answer and then Submit.

_reset.feedback:
You didn’t pass, achieving a score of {{scoreAsPercent}}%.

You've run out of attempts.

Please select Restart course to review the course content, before attempting this assessment again.

_bands.feedback:
You didn’t pass, achieving a score of {{scoreAsPercent}}%.

You may wish to review some of the content again, before attempting this assessment again.

You have {{attemptsLeft}} attempt(s) remaining.

You passed, achieving a score of {{scoreAsPercent}}%.

You may wish to review some of the content again.
